item.title: Euler Project Problem 25 using Python
item.description: Problem Problem 25: 1000-digit Fibonacci number The Fibonacci sequence is defined by the recurrence relation: F(n) = F(n-1) + F(n-2), where F(1) = 1 and F(2) = 1. Hence the first 12 terms will be: F(1) = 1 F(2) = 1 F(3) = 2 F(4) = 3 F(5) = 5 F(6) = 8 F(7) = 13 F(8) = 21 F(9) = 34 F(10) = 55 F(11) = 89 F(12) = 144
